item.title: Using TextMate and Python's virtualenv
item.description: TextMate is a great text editor for MacOs. But the default Python bundle does not recognize Python’s virtual environments (virtualenv), which is rather annoying. No need to modify your Textmate bundle. This can be solved by declaring a project-specific shell variable named TM_PYTHON and assigning your virtualenv’s custom python’s path to it: In TextMate, create a new project for your python program Open the Project Drawer Window (View/Open Project Drawer) Make sure no file is selected in the drawer.
